item.ptxt: Use the same procedures for the LH side and RH side.
The procedures listed below are for the LH side.

s2.ptxt: Align the matchmarks and install the disc.

atten4.ptxt: When replacing the disc with a new one, select the installation position where the disc has the smallest runout.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL FRONT DISC BRAKE CYLINDER MOUNTING LH

s2.ptxt: Install the disc brake cylinder mounting with the 2 bolts.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL FRONT DISC BRAKE PAD SUPPORT PLATE

s2.ptxt: Install the 4 pad support plates to the cylinder mounting.
Install the pad wear indicator plates to the inner lower side of the pad.
Install the No. 1 anti-squeal shims and No. 2 anti-squeal shims to the pads.

item.ptxt: When replacing a worn pad, the shims must be replaced together with the pads.
Install the shims in the correct positions and directions as shown in the illustration.

s2.ptxt: Install the 2 disc brake pads to the cylinder mounting.

atten3.ptxt: Make sure there is no oil or grease on the friction surfaces of the pads and disc.

s2.ptxt: Apply a light coat of lithium soap base glycol grease to the No. 1 collar.
Install the No. 1 collar to the disc brake cylinder assembly.
Apply a light coat of lithium soap base glycol grease to the No. 2 collar.
Install the No. 2 collar to the disc brake cylinder assembly.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL FRONT DISC BRAKE BUSH DUST BOOT

s2.ptxt: Apply a light coat of lithium soap base glycol grease to the entire circumference of 4 new front disc brake bush dust boots where they contact the disc brake cylinder, and the entire inner circumference of both ends of the boots.

atten4.ptxt: Apply at least 0.3 g (0.01 oz.) of lithium soap base glycol grease to the front disc brake bush dust boot.

atten3.ptxt: Apply a sufficient amount of lithium soap base glycol grease to the entire circumference of the front disc brake bush dust boot and disc brake cylinder contact surfaces.

s2.ptxt: Install the 4 front disc brake bush dust boots to the disc brake cylinder assembly.
Apply a light coat of lithium soap base glycol grease to the No. cylinder slide bush.
Install the No. 1 cylinder slide bush to the disc brake cylinder assembly.
Apply a light coat of lithium soap base glycol grease to the No. 2 cylinder slide bush.
Install the No. 2 cylinder slide bush to the disc brake cylinder assembly.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL DISC BRAKE CYLINDER ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Install the disc brake cylinder with the 2 bolts.
Install a new gasket and connect the flexible hose with a new union bolt.

atten4.ptxt: Insert the flexible hose lock securely into the lock hole in the cylinder.

specitem.ptxt: SAE J1703 or FMVSS No. 116 DOT3

s-1.ptxt: BLEED AIR FROM BRAKE MASTER CYLINDER

atten4.ptxt: If the master cylinder has been disassembled or if the reservoir becomes empty, bleed air from the master cylinder.

s2.ptxt: Using a union nut wrench, disconnect the 2 brake lines from the master cylinder.
Slowly depress and hold down the brake pedal.
Cover the outer holes with your fingers, and release the pedal.
Repeat the 2 previous steps 3 or 4 times.
Using a union nut wrench, connect the 2 brake lines to the master cylinder.

atten3.ptxt: Use the formula to calculate special torque values for situations where a union nut wrench is combined with a torque wrench (See page ).

s2.ptxt: Remove the bleeder plug cap.
Connect a vinyl tube to the bleeder plugs.
Depress the pedal several times, and then loosen the bleeder plug with the pedal depressed.
When fluid stops coming out, immediately tighten the bleeder plug. Then release the pedal.
Repeat the 2 previous steps until all the air in the brake fluid is gone.
Tighten the bleeder plug.
Install the cap.
Bleed air from the brake line for each wheel by repeating the above procedures.
Remove the brake master cylinder reservoir filler cap assembly.
Add brake fluid to keep the level between the MIN and MAX lines of the reservoir while bleeding the clutch line.

specitem.ptxt: SAE J1703 or FMVSS No. 116 DOT3

s2.ptxt: Remove the bleeder plug cap.
Connect a vinyl tube to the bleeder plug.
Depress the clutch pedal several times, and then loosen the bleeder plug with the pedal depressed.
At the point when fluid stops coming out, tighten the bleeder plug, and then release the clutch pedal.
Repeat the previous 2 steps until all the air in the fluid is completely bled out.
Tighten the bleeder plug.
Install the bleeder plug cap.
Check that all the air has been bled out of the clutch line.
Check for brake fluid leaks.
Check the brake fluid level in the reservoir (See page ).
Install the brake master cylinder reservoir filler cap assembly.

s-1.ptxt: CHECK BRAKE FLUID LEVEL IN RESERVOIR

s2.ptxt: Check the fluid level and add fluid if necessary.

specitem.ptxt: SAE J1703 or FMVSS No. 116 DOT3

atten4.ptxt: Add fluid to a level between the reservoir's MIN and MAX lines.

s2.ptxt: Install the front wheel.
